column4: I think that when I had a power cut, it corrupted the data on the hard drive
I need a way to format the Hard Drive, I cannot enter the live CD or Enter Ubuntu
Well, it starts, then it freezes as it reads the hard drive
thus leading me to believe the the Drive may be corrupted and stopping the Install
I think it is the Hard Drive, not the memory
when trying to boot, it says "Cannot read 'blah blah blah'
it says... Mount: Mounting /Dev on /root/dev failed: No Such file or Directory
who says it? /Dev is not a device and so you cannot mount it
but I think that on boot you don'e enter ubuntu, but a Busybox console... don't you?
please, try to search on the forum because there is surely a topic on how to restore ubuntu with such kind of error. Now I'm trying to find for you too
I thought the whole point of an Ubuntu chat room was to enter it and get help from other Ubuntu Geeks who know about Computers more than I, no offense...
you're right, but now I can't help you... but I'm sure there are topics can help you better. Such as: http://art.ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1568704
dont you think I've tried that, with the shift key?
http://superuser.com/questions/207788/ubuntu-fails-to-start-after-system-update-displays-busybox-notice-on-command-lin try it. Sorry, it is the only way I can help you now
